alert.note: Alert for Bell; Clay; Knox; Leslie; Owsley; Perry (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 22 at 1:01PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Bell, northern Knox, southeastern Owsley, Leslie, central Perry and eastern Clay Counties through 130 PM EST... At 100 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Ammie to Woollum to Rossland. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Seth, Oneida, Ogle, Barcreek, Hensley, Spurlock, Teges, Wild Cat, Enline and Bluehole around 105 PM EST. Brightshade, Panco, Brutus, Whoopflarea, Lipps, Jacks Creek, Plank, Botto, Goose Rock and Bear Branch around 110 PM EST. Ashers Fork, Ice Cliff, Saul, Sizerock and Bobs Fork around 115 PM EST. Queendale, Roark, Barnyard, Kaliopi, Walker, Dewitt, Skidmore, Confluence, Scalf and Shoal around 120 PM EST. Other locations in the path of these storms include Hyden, Toulouse, Mills, Mosley Bend, Warbranch, Essie, Wooton, Spruce Pine, Hazard, Mozelle, Field, Avawam, Chappell, Asher, Erose, Beverly, Hoskinston and Sandy Fork. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Bell; Clay; Knox; Leslie; Owsley; Perry
